ExplntnTxt: NO ASSETS AVAILABLE TO DISTRIBUTE AS ALL ASSETS WERE DEEMED WORTHLESS.
PERSON(S) INVOLVED: DR. PHILLIP SMITH, MS. NANCYE ALLOWAY, DR. TERNAE JORDAN, DR. HERBERT RAWLINGS, BYRON EDENS

EXPLANATION OF INVOLVEMENT: DR. PHILLIP SMITH, MS. NANCYE ALLOWAY, DR. TERNAE JORDAN, DR. HERBERT RAWLINGS - TENNESSEE TEMPLE UNIVERSITY TRUSTEES ARE NOW ON THE BOARD OF PIEDMONT INTERNATIONAL UNIVERSITY.BYRON EDENS - EVP OF TENNESSEE TEMPLE UNIVERSITY BECAME THE VP OF ACADEMIC INITIATIVES, HE WILL IDENTIFY AND FACILITATE STRATEGIC PARTNERSHIPS WITH LIKEMINDED ORGANIZATIONS AND PROVIDE SUPPORT TO ONLINE PROGRAMS.

ON MARCH 4, 2015, THE UNIVERSITY ANNOUNCED A PLAN OF MERGER WITH PIEDMONT INTERNATIONAL UNIVERSITY, INC. (PIEDMONT), AN ESTABLISHED PROVIDER OF QUALITY, BIBLE-CENTERED HIGHER EDUCATION BASED IN NORTH CAROLINA. FOLLOWING COMPLETION OF THE MERGER, PIEDMONT WILL BE THE SURVIVING UNIVERSITY. SUBJECT TO CERTAIN CONDITIONS AND CONTINGENCIES SET FORTH IN THE MERGER AGREEMENT, THE MERGER IS EFFECTIVE APRIL 30, 2015.UPON COMPLETION OF THE MERGER, PIEDMONT WILL OBTAIN THE UNIVERSITY'S ASSETS AND CERTAIN LIABILITIES, INCLUDING THE FOLLOWING: ALL PROPERTY, PLANT AND EQUIPMENT OWNED BY THE UNIVERSITY, CASH, ENTITIES CONTROLLED BY THE UNIVERSITY, INCLUDING THE TENNESSEE TEMPLE UNIVERSITY ENDOWMENT FUND, INC., EDUCATIONAL RESOURCES, INTANGIBLES, ALL OTHER ASSETS, AND CERTAIN DEBT LIABILITIES SPECIFICALLY DESCRIBED BY THE MERGER AGREEMENT.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE N, PART II, PAGE 2, LINE 2E
ExplntnTxt: DR. OLGA RODRIGUEZ AFTER SEPTEMBER 5, 2014 BECAME THE DEAN OF MEDICINE AT ARIST MEDICAL SCIENCES UNIVERSITY

TWO TRUSTEES FROM EMMANUEL CHRISTIAN SEMINARY, STEPHEN MOORE AND BENJAMIN CACHIARAS, WERE INVITED TO JOIN THE MILLIGAN COLLEGE BOARD OF TRUSTEES AS OF JULY 1, 2015, THE EFFECTIVE DATE OF THE MERGER. BOTH TRUSTEES ACCEPTED THE INVITATION AND ARE CURRENTLY SERVING ON THE MILLIGAN COLLEGE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. THE TRUSTEES DID NOT RECEIVE ANY FINANCIAL INCENTIVE, BONUS OR COMPENSATION FROM MILLIGAN COLLEGE AS A RESULT OF THE MERGER.

TWO OFFICERS FROM EMMANUEL CHRISTIAN SEMINARY WERE HIRED BY MILLIGAN COLLEGE: DR. ROLLIN RAMSARAN AND DANIEL LAWSON. DR. ROLLIN RAMSARAN SERVED AS THE CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER AND ACADEMIC DEAN OF EMMANUEL CHRISTIAN SEMINARY FROM JUNE 1, 2014 TO JUNE 30, 2015. MILLIGAN COLLEGE HIRED DR. RAMSARAN TO SERVE AS THE ACADEMIC DEAN OF THE SEMINARY BEGINING JULY 1, 2015. DR. RAMSARAN REPORTS TO THE VICE PRESIDENT FOR ACADEMIC AFFAIRS AT MILLIGAN COLLEGE. DR. RAMSARAN WAS OFFERED THE SAME LEVEL OF PAY FROM MILLIGAN COLLEGE THAT HE WAS RECEIVING AT EMMANUEL CHRISTIAN SEMINARY. NO OTHER FINANCIAL INCENTIVES, BONUSES, OR COMPENSATION WERE PAID IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE MERGER. DANIEL LAWSON SERVED AS THE DIRECTOR OF DEVELOPMENT AT EMMANUEL CHRISTIAN SEMINARY AND WAS AN OFFICER OF THE ORGANIZATION. MR. LAWSON RETIRED FROM EMMANUEL ON MAY 31, 2015, ONE MONTH PRIOR TO THE MERGER. MILLIGAN COLLEGE HIRED DAN LAWSON TO SERVE AS A GIFT OFFICER FOR THE DONORS OF EMMANUEL CHRISTIAN SEMINARY BEGINNING JUNE 1, 2015. MR. LAWSON ACCEPTED AN OFFER FROM MILLIGAN COLLEGE TO WORK ON A 70% SCHEDULE AND WAS OFFERED 70% OF THE PAY HE WAS RECEIVING AT EMMANUEL CHRISTIAN SEMINARY. NO OTHER FINANCIAL INCENTIVES, BONUSES, OR COMPENSATION WERE PAID IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE MERGER.

PERSON(S) INVOLVED: THE ORGANIZATION WAS SOLD TO DUKE LIFEPOINT HEALTHCARE ON AUGUST 31, 2014. SOME OF THE TRUSTEES AND EMPLOYEES OF THE ORGANIZATION REMAINED WITH THE TRANSFEREE ORGANIZATION, DUKE LIFEPOINT HEALTHCARE.
